required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: User Study of an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial is designed to assess an investigational blood glucose monitoring system with fingerstick blood in the hands of untrained intended users.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
primary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes tested self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasm BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15 mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Study Staff Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method When Testing Subject Blood Glucose (BG)
secondary_outcome.description: Study staff tested subject fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results.

arm_group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick.

intervention.description: Tradewind is a Bayer investigational meter that used an investigational sensor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 or type 2 diabetes
- 18 years of age and older
- Able to speak, read, and understand English
- Willing to complete all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously participated in a study using this investigational system
- Working for a medical laboratory, hospital, or other clinical setting that involves training on and clinical use of blood glucose monitors
- Pregnancy
- Hemophilia or any other bleeding disorder
- Working for a competitive medical device company or having an immediate family member or someone who is not a family member but is living within the household of someone who works for such a company
- A condition which, in the opinion of the investigator, would put the person or study conduct at risk (reason for exclusion will be clearly documented by investigator or designee).

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick. Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System : Tradewind is a Bayer investigational meter that used an investigational sensor.

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Study results from 2 subjects were excluded from all data analysis, because study staff inadvertently performed study tasks that could be considered 'training' them. (According to protocol, training was not allowed.)

outcome.title: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes tested self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasm BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15 mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 115(115x1)test results are possible. 118 subjects tested one of 3 test strip lots on the BGM system. Study results from 2 subjects were excluded from all data analyses as already described. One subject test exceeded time interval (defined in protocol) between meter test and reference method.

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick. Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System : Tradewind is a Bayer investigational meter that used an investigational sensor.

measure.title: Number of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
measure.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes tested self-test fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasm BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15 mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results (YSI capillary plasma).
measure.population: 115(115x1)test results are possible. 118 subjects tested one of 3 test strip lots on the BGM system. Study results from 2 subjects were excluded from all data analyses as already described. One subject test exceeded time interval (defined in protocol) between meter test and reference method.

outcome.title: Number of Study Staff Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method When Testing Subject Blood Glucose (BG)
outcome.description: Study staff tested subject fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results.
outcome.population: 115 (115x1) test results are possible. Staff tested blood from 118 subjects (one of 3 test strip lots). All study results from 2 subjects were excluded from data analyses as already described. Also, one test exceeded time interval (defined in protocol) between meter test and reference method.

group.title: Study Staff
group.description: Study staff also used the investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS) (Tatus/Tradewind Investigational Blood Glucose Meter)

measure.title: Number of Study Staff Results Within +/- 15mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) or Within +/- 20% (>=75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method When Testing Subject Blood Glucose (BG)
measure.description: Study staff tested subject fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS), which included an investigational meter and sensor. BGM results were compared with capillary plasma BG results obtained with a reference lab glucose method - Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. BG meter results were used to calculate the number of BG results within +/- 15mg/dL (for reference BG results <75mg/dL) or +/- 20% (for reference BG results >=75mg/dL) of the reference method results.
measure.population: 115 (115x1) test results are possible. Staff tested blood from 118 subjects (one of 3 test strip lots). All study results from 2 subjects were excluded from data analyses as already described. Also, one test exceeded time interval (defined in protocol) between meter test and reference method.

group.title: Intended Users of the System
group.description: Untrained subjects with diabetes use an investigational blood glucose monitoring system (Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System) to self-test capillary blood obtained from fingerstick. Tatsu/Tradewind Investigational BG Monitoring System : Tradewind is a Bayer investigational meter that used an investigational sensor.

event.description: Inclusion criteria for study stated that subjects must have diabetes. Adverse events were mild, anticipated, and not device-related.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Carmine Greene, Senior Clinical Research Scientist
